column1: EZ = economic zone; EPZ = export processing zone; FTZ = free trade zone; FZ = free zone; SEZ = special economic zone
Two dots (..) indicate that the information is not available. A blank indicates that the item is not applicable.
a  UN Member States, Hong Kong (China), Macao (China), Taiwan Province of China and other selected economies with at least one zone.
b  Where available, the number of officially approved or notified SEZ projects in pipeline were counted. Otherwise, the most conservative estimates were made based on secondary sources.
c  Based on Bost (2010 and 2017) and updated where possible.
d  National SEZ laws mapped in chapter IV.B are underlined or hyperlinked.
e  This law has no relevance to the two zones identified.

f  Two existing industrial estates and four industrial parks under construction, which the Government considers as "SEZs", were not counted due to the lack of information confirming the provision of special incentives and the absence of national SEZ law. The four industrial parks (scheduled to be operational in 2022-2023), nevertheless, were counted as planned SEZs.

g  Fiscal incentives granted under this decree expired in 2011. Incentives for enterprises with the Tax Free Zone (TFZ) license were scheduled to phase out in 2015 (WTO, 2016). No amendment or new law repealing this decree has been found.

h Of the published list of 107 FZs, 11 FZ developers were counted as FZs. From the list of 10 SEZs, one SEZ promoter and five SEZ developers were counted as SEZs under development. Thirty-five standalone FZs and three single-entity SEZs were counted as free points.

i  The number of active zones was derived from the Annex to the Law of Turkmenistan on Free EZs. The three additional zones on the list of Free Economic Zones in the World (https://freeeconomiczones.weebly.com) were counted as zones under development.
